results.title: Freedom in the genes
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, David Sington, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Is behaviour inherited and destined since birth? This episode from the ‘Cracking the code’ series explores this question with the aid of the world’s largest gathering of twins, English sheepdogs, trained flies plus other animal assistants.

results.title: Freedom from dust
results.brief_description: Surveys the problem of industrial air and water pollution, and the difficulties of effective waste disposal. Shows the instruments which are used to measure pollution in industrial areas, and the various possible measures to prevent or alleviate it.

results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.

results.title: Free Willy 3: the rescue
results.creator_credit: Sam Pillsbury, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Regency Entertainment (USA), Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Willy’s best friend, Jesse (Jason James Richter), is working with his mentor Randolph (August Schellenberg) monitoring whales off the Pacific Northwest coast. He befriends a young boy, Max, who shares Jesse’s love for whales. Max’s fisherman father however possesses a mysterious secret linked to the depleting orca population and it is up to Jesse and Max to embark on a rescue mission to save the whales. An entertaining family movie that is as much about whale conservation as it is about two boys love for whales. Also starring Annie Corley, Vincent Berry and Patrick Kilpatrick.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Dwight Little, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Donner Productions and Shuler-Donner
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Lauren Shuler, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Wincer, Lauren Shuler, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+

results.title: Free to roam
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Stuart Legg and Strand Film Zoological Productions
results.brief_description: At Whipsnade Zoo, 35 miles from London, there is an unusual zoo; a great expanse of English downland is reserved for animals to roam as they do in their native habitats. To the reserve come naturalists and zoologists from many countries, for on these 500 acres of English soil, animal life from all over the world may be studied. The film makes use of interesting natural sound.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Stuart Legg and Strand Film Zoological Productions

results.title: Free to move (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Lewis, Ted Channell, Derek Monk, Schools Council and Southern Films
results.brief_description: Attempts to show that physical education is concerned with the education of the whole child, not only his physical well being. Shows need for a broad based and varied programme of activities; and how related work in other areas of the curriculum may spring from or lead to work in movement. Presents a composite picture of the balanced programme offered in a good primary school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Lewis, Ted Channell, Derek Monk, Schools Council and Southern Films

results.title: Free to move
results.brief_description: This video is about friction: the resistance generated when one solid surface slides in contact with another. It is also about how we reduce the forces of friction by lubrication and how lubrication controls wear, to lengthen the life of the moving parts of machinery.
results.description: This video is about friction: the resistance generated when one solid surface slides in contact with another. It is also about how we reduce the forces of friction by lubrication and how lubrication controls wear, to lengthen the life of the moving parts of machinery.
